ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
More advanced Chinese vocabulary, grammar, and usage. Formal speaking and writing styles. More work on Chinese idioms (, , and ) than in CHNS 150.
Gained greater confidence in more formal speech and writing.

Really developed advanced Chinese language skills, and speaking skills in-class. Have a deeper overall understanding of Chinese, and feel that the Chinese Ive learned is really applicable to real life. Great experience.
Better understanding of the chinese language and culture

I steadily but substantively improved my Chinese on all fronts over the course of this spring in Sun Laoshi's CHNS 151 section. I think my speaking skills particularly improved, though my writing, reading, and listening did as well. I now feel well-prepared to spend most of my summer in Taipei living and studying Chinese.
Conversational and formal Chinese vocab and sentence structures; reading comprehension skills; formal essay writing skills; listening comprehension; grammar.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths - Sun Laoshi is amazing at giving examples for vocabulary usage. Just from attending lecture, you get a very good intuitive understanding of these new vocabulary words. She is also very patient and understanding, and excited to incorporate personal details that she knows about her students into the lectures.
Weaknesses - I think there could be a little more focus on writing. There are only 2 or 3 essays/writing pieces a semester and maybe one or two more could be really helpful in making me more confident in writing.

Strengths: course structure, TEACHER!!, in-class discussions, homework structure. 

Weaknesses: I wish we had received more feedback on our in-class speaking - sometimes tones/ungrammatical sentences would not be corrected, which made me confused on what the correct way to say something was.
Strengths are the teachers and faculty

Strengths: enthusiasm of teacher, variety of exercises, greater relevance to my interests and real world than CNHS 150, passion of classmates

Weaknesses: In one sense, the schedule of this course was reliable in a comforting way. But sometimes the structure of class time felt repetitive, and I feel that we could benefit from more frequent class discussions rather than simply going through the lesson text, vocabulary, and grammar structures.

Strengths: Sun laoshi is the best teacher ever and makes the class super engaging! The course material is super fun to read. The class includes so many different types of assignments so it doesn't get boring. Learned a variety of skills. Lots of detailed feedback that is really helpful. 

Weaknesses: way too much homework, which doesn't allow us enough time to engage with the material as much as we want to. Sometimes have to rush through homework so you don't spend all day every day doing Chinese homework.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! This class feels really fulfilling. There isn't too much homework between each class, the only assignments you really need to worry about are the essays and presentations.
Yes! Amazing course - I feel like Ive improved so much this year.
Yes, if you're interested in taking a language because the teachers are so great.
Yes, particularly if they are committed to becoming proficient/fluent in Chinese. I would especially recommend my teacher, Chuanmei Sun.

ABSOLUTELY! especially if sun laoshi is teaching it. She's amazing, truly cares about her students, and is always available to help. I am super grateful to have studied Chinese with her and cannot sing her praises enough. I learned a lot through this course and it has inspired me to continue learning Chinese.
Absolutely!! Sun Laoshi is amazing and this was an incredible semester.
